summary.para: Retrieves the category—virtual, fixed, common, or per-user—of the selected folder.

param.name: pCategory
param.para: Type: *
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the of the selected folder.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves a structure that contains the defining elements of a known folder, which includes the folder's category, name, path, description, tooltip, icon, and other properties.

param.name: pKFD
param.para: Type: *
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the structure. When no longer needed, the calling application is responsible for calling to free this resource.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: When a third-party application creates their own known folder, they do so by defining it with a structure, then registering it with the system. Any registered known folder definition information—system-provided or application-created—can be retrieved through this method.
To call this method, the caller must have at least User privileges.

param.name: pftid
param.para: Type: FOLDERTYPEID*
When this returns, contains a pointer to a FOLDERTYPEID (a GUID) that identifies the known folder type.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the ID of the selected folder.

param.name: pkfid
param.para: Type: KNOWNFOLDERID*
When this method returns, returns the KNOWNFOLDERID value of the known folder. Note, KNOWNFOLDERID values are GUIDs.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the location of the Shell namespace folder in the IDList () form.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that specify special retrieval options. This value can be 0; otherwise, one or more of the values.

param.name: ppidl
param.para: Type: PIDLIST_ABSOLUTE*

When this method returns, contains the address of an absolute PIDL. This parameter is passed uninitialized. The calling application is responsible for freeing this resource when it is no longer needed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves the path of a known folder as a string.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that specify special retrieval options. This value can be 0; otherwise, one or more of the values.

param.name: ppszPath
param.para: Type: LPWSTR*

When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a null-terminated buffer that contains the path. The calling application is responsible for calling to free this resource when it is no longer needed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets a value that states whether the known folder can have its path set to a new value or what specific restrictions or prohibitions are placed on that redirection.

param.name: pCapabilities
param.para: Type: *
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a value that indicates the redirection capabilities for this folder.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Retrieves the location of a known folder in the Shell namespace in the form of a Shell item ( or derived interface).

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that specify special retrieval options. This value can be 0; otherwise, one or more of the values.

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
A reference to the IID of the requested interface.

param.name: ppv
param.para: Type: void**
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically or .

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Assigns a new path to a known folder.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Either zero or the following value:
Set the full path without environment strings. If this flag is not set, portions of the path at pszPath may be represented by environment strings such as %USERPROFILE%.

param.name: pszPath
param.para: Type: LPCWSTR

Pointer to the folder's new path. This is a null-terminated Unicode string of length MAX_PATH. This path cannot be of zero length. If this value is NULL, the IKnownFolder.SetPath sets the path to the default value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method cannot be called on folders of type or .
To call this method on a folder of type , the calling application must be running with elevated privileges.

summary.para: Exposes methods that allow an application to retrieve information about a known folder's category, type, GUID, pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) value, redirection capabilities, and definition. It provides a method for the retrieval of a known folder's object. It also provides methods to get or set the path of the known folder.

remarks.para: IKnownFolder objects can be obtained through several methods of the interface, such as and .
Third parties do not implement IKnownFolder. Use the provided implementation.
